title: Doctor Who star Peter Capaldi reveals who he wants to replace him as the Time Lord
text:

Doctor Who star Peter Capaldi wants a woman to replace him – saying Rising Damp’s Frances de la Tour should play the Time Lord. 
Frances – Rigsby’s love interest in the 70s sitcom – would finally break the show’s male dominance of 12 male leads. 
Speaking after the Mirror revealed he was leaving the show, Peter said: “The time felt right to bow out, to let somebody else play this wonderful role and I would like Frances de la Tour to be first female doctor.” 
But show insiders say incoming boss Chris Chibnall is eyeing Andrew Buchan as the 13th Time Lord, having worked with him over the past five years. 
Buchan, 37, is best known for playing Mark Latimer, the father of murdered schoolboy Danny in Chibnall’s hit ITV series Broadchurch , which returns for its final run later this month. Read More Steven Moffat, Mark Gatiss, David Tennant and more praise Peter Capaldi after actor announces he is quitting Doctor Who Frances De La Tour is Peter's choice for the 13th Doctor (Photo: BBC) 
One insider said: Andrew would fit what the BBC want – a more youthful Doctor, who will appeal to the traditional fan base of kids and young adults.” Comment Below 
But Billie Piper, who played Dr who’s sidekick Rose Tyler during David Tennant’s run as the Time Lord, agreed with Capaldi that it was time for a female Doctor , arguing it would “feel like a snub” if it didn’t happen. 
“I think it would be great given the spirit of the world at the moment,” she added. Frances in Rising Damp (Photo: Yorkshire Television) 
She was backed by former Labour deputy leader Harriet Harman who said: “Of course, there should be a female Doctor Who but we need a man as her assistant, that’s the important thing.” 
Bookies fancy James Norton, Ben Whishaw and Russell Tovey as the favourites to land the role. 
Others in the running include IT Crowd star Richard Ayoade with female contenders including Sherlock’s Lara Pulver, Line of Duty’s Vicky McClure and even comic Miranda Hart. Andrew Buchan is said to be the incoming show boss's first choice (Photo: Getty) 
Norton, 31, caused a stir as the villain in award-winning BBC1 drama Happy Valley. Whishaw, 36, is a hugely popular choice thanks to his success as Q in the recent Bond films while Tovey, 35, also has a strong fan base thanks to his role alongside Aidan Turner in supernatural drama Being Human. 
Bookies were offering 8/1 against any female landing the part. 
James Norton was 9/1, Ben Whishaw and Lara Pulver 10/1, Richard Ayoade 11/1, Russell Tovey 12/1, Vicky McClure 20/1 and Donald Trump, 2000/1. How the Daily Mirror reported Peter's shock news What does the future hold? 
Doctor Who’s popularity has waned in recent years, with some feeling Capaldi lacked the dynamism of predecessors Matt Smith and David Tennant. 
And writer Steven Moffat was blasted for his “over-complicated” plots. BBC chiefs are now seeking a clean sweep for Chris Chibnall’s first run in 2018. 
One source revealed: “The BBC management would love a return to the format of the show in Tennant’s time.” Video Loading
